member.name: M:Chinchilla.StateManagement.IContextCacheItemCollection.SetData(System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds the specified item with expiration.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The item to be added to the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null
The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object expires and is removed from the cache 20 minutes after it is last accessed. If you are using absolute expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

member.name: M:Chinchilla.StateManagement.Web.IWebContextCacheItemCollection.SetData(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Adds the specified item to the System.Web.Caching.Cache object with dependencies, expiration and priority policies, and a delegate you can use to notify your application when the inserted item is removed from the Cache.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The item to be added to the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null
The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object expires and is removed from the cache 20 minutes after it is last accessed. If you are using absolute expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

The relative cost of the object, as expressed by the CacheItemPriority enumeration. The cache uses this value when it evicts objects; objects with a lower cost are removed from the cache before objects with a higher cost.
A delegate that, if provided, is called when an object is removed from the cache. You can use this to notify applications when their objects are deleted from the cache.
member.returns: An object if the item was previously stored in the Cache; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Chinchilla.StateManagement.Web.WebContextCacheItemCollection.GetData(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an object with the specified name from the System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.CallContext.
member.param: The name of the item in the call context.
member.returns: The object in the call context associated with the specified name.

member.name: M:Chinchilla.StateManagement.Web.WebContextCacheItemCollection.SetData(System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds the specified item with expiration.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The item to be added to the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null
The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object expires and is removed from the cache 20 minutes after it is last accessed. If you are using absolute expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

member.name: M:Chinchilla.StateManagement.Web.WebContextCacheItemCollection.SetData(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Adds the specified item to the System.Web.Caching.Cache object with dependencies, expiration and priority policies, and a delegate you can use to notify your application when the inserted item is removed from the Cache.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The item to be added to the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null
The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object expires and is removed from the cache 20 minutes after it is last accessed. If you are using absolute expiration, the parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

The relative cost of the object, as expressed by the CacheItemPriority enumeration. The cache uses this value when it evicts objects; objects with a lower cost are removed from the cache before objects with a higher cost.
A delegate that, if provided, is called when an object is removed from the cache. You can use this to notify applications when their objects are deleted from the cache.
member.returns: An object if the item was previously stored in the Cache; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskExtensions
member.summary: A set of extension methods to allow a much safer usage of tasks.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskExtensions.StartNewSafely(System.Threading.Tasks.TaskFactory,System.Action)
member.summary: This method will ensure all thread based storage values are copied into the used by this . This will ensure logging and eventing will work far more smoothly.
member.remarks: Value changes will be passed back out.
